column1: Before Fred could complete the sentence his foot struck an obstruction and he was precipitated headlong over and down a chasm which had escaped his notice. He fell with such violence that he was knocked senseless.When he recovered he was in darkness
column2: his torch having been extinguished. The smell of the burning resin recalled him to himself
column3: and it required but a moment for him to remember the accident which had befallen him. For a time he scarcely dared to stir
column4: fearing that he might pitch headlong over some precipice. He felt of his face and hands
column5: but could detect nothing like blood. The boy had received quite a number of severe bruises
column7: and when he ventured to stir there were sharp
column9: neck and legs."Thank God I am alive!" was his fervent ejaculation
column10: after he had taken his inventory. "But I don't know where I am or how I can get back again. I wonder what has become of the torch."
